components.description:
A tabbed folder, as used to file papers in a cabinet or as an icon for a file on a computer. Most platforms depict a yellow folder, as manila, with the tab shown at the left.

Commonly used for various content concerning filing, organization, and work, especially at an office.

Apple’s folder is gray, Twitter’s is blue. Google’s design previously featured multiple tabs, Microsoft’s a blue tab.

Nearly identical in appearance and use to üìÇ Open File Folder, which is slightly open.
components.title: File Folder

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A¬†folder used to store¬†files in a filing cabinet. Also used as an icon for a folder on most GUI operating systems. File Folder was approved  http://emojipedia.org/file-folder/
emoji_net_data.name: file folder

bn:00021475n: A computer file is a resource for storing information, which is available to a computer program and is usually based on some kind of durable storage.
A collection of information that is stored on a computer under a single name.
(computer science) a file maintained in computer-readable form
An aggregation of data on a storage device, identified by a name.
The name of a menu in a conversation window from which the user can save the text of the current conversation, open received files, or close the conversation window.
Block of arbitrary information, or resource for storing information, which is available to a computer program
